Headline: Artificial Intelligence Engineer | MSc. Artificial Intelligence | Computer Vision | Natural Language Processing | LLMs | HPC
Summary: I am deeply passionate about artificial intelligence, and about integrating a multitude of techniques into a wide array of domains. I have a broad experience on numerous artificial intelligence projects across diverse domains, such as machine learning, deep learning, computer vision and natural language processing. Iâ€™ve also had experience in orchestrating and executing large language models (LLMs)on cutting-edge high-performance computing systems (HPC).
Degree - Education: Master of Science - MSc Artificial Intelligence (Intelligent Interactive Systems)
Summary - Awards: Award to the team that made the best project in the SDG 4 category in the Facebook F8 Hackathon (https://devpost.com/software/icode). The project consists of a chatbot integrated into a Facebook page that helps teach programming basics to children.
Summary - Projects: In the constantly evolving landscape of information processing, the ability of language models to distinguish between mutable and stable facts becomes paramount. This project unpacks this capability, exploring how these models integrate newly acquired information during a conversation. Utilizing OPT, GPT, and LLaMA, I investigate whether large language models exhibit an understanding of a factâ€™s stability, and if their responses vary when exposed to prompts that introduce changes to facts. Findings hint at a noteworthy phenomenon: language models do display a level of understanding of the stability of facts and are distinctively swayed by distractors present in the prompt. This project focus into the adaptability of language models amidst ever-changing real-world contexts. This work was done in the High Performance Cluster (HPC-UPF) using SLURM, Python, Pandas, Numpy, PyTorch, HuggingFace, Princeton Optiprompt, GPT API, OPT (Meta AI LLM) and Llama (Meta AI).

I founded Authentikos, an educational platform dedicated to preserving local knowledge and traditions, showcasing them through digital content such as interviews and documentaries. This project aims to foster cultural understanding and fair trade in a globalized world.
Summary - Experience:
Authentikos is an educational and cultural platform that celebrates the authentic stories of individuals, communities, and cultures. Our purpose is to bridge traditions, ancestral knowledge, and the modern world, fostering genuine connections and intercultural understanding through transformative content and experiences.

We make authenticity visible: We rescue stories, traditions, and practices that reflect the cultural essence of communities around the world, promoting their value and continuity.
We foster intercultural connections: We build bridges between people, producers, artisans, and businesses, emphasizing the importance of respect and empathy in cultural exchange.
We promote alternative businesses: We support artisans and small producers by connecting them with a global audience that values authenticity, helping to strengthen their work and promote sustainability.
We design cultural experiences: Through workshops, travel, and activities, we provide opportunities to experience authentic immersions that connect with tradition and nature.

Our Values
Respect for the local
Sustainability
Genuine connection

Authentikos is not just a platform; it is a movement to preserve, celebrate, and connect with authenticity. Through educational content and immersive experiences, we offer a transformative vision that inspires people to value traditions, foster intercultural understanding, and support local communities.
We aspire to be a global reference for those seeking to discover the worldâ€™s cultural riches authentically, positively impacting the people and communities that make this diversity possible. Authentikos is for those who wish to explore the world with purpose, learning and connecting from the heart.

â€¢ Carried out strategic planning processes, identifying several important factors for the company, such as: the relationship with suppliers, the bargaining power of its clients, the level of competition and substitute products, and the company's relationship with its stakeholders. All this data was transformed to group them into strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats for the company. From these conclusions, I extracted strategic objectives on which to base a long-term plan for the company's growth.

â€¢ As a complementary aspect of the financial analysis, I conducted sensitivity analyses on the company's key variables. Based on historical information, I was able to determine, within a confidence interval, the possible outcomes for the company if these variables changed. This allowed me to obtain the worst possible results, the best possible results, as well as the most probable outcome for the company, given the historical data.

Headline: LABEX director @UPB | Experimental Design, Behavioral Economics
Summary: With over 8 years of experience in economics, I am passionate about conducting experimental research that can inform and improve public policies and social outcomes. As the director of the Laboratory of Experimental Economics (LABEX) at Universidad Privada Boliviana (UPB), I lead a team of researchers and collaborators who design and implement innovative projects that study the behavior, preferences, and decision-making of diverse populations in Bolivia. In my current role, I oversee the development and execution of various experimental studies that address relevant and timely topics, such as risk exposure, organic food consumption, interpersonal trust, tax compliance, and improvement in self-employment quality. I also teach graduate and undergraduate courses in economics at UPB, and mentor students and junior researchers who are interested in pursuing experimental economics. I am fluent in English, Spanish, and I enjoy learning new languages (Mandarin, Portuguese, Italian, Aymara) and cultures by traveling.

Field Of Study - Education: Mechanical Engineering with Aerospace Engineering Concetration
Summary - Projects: A team of 8 students prepared a cluster to run a set of computationally intensive applications. We were allowed to pack into the cluster as much hardware we could have operational without tripping a power budget of 15 amps from an industrial source. My tasks included maintaining and setting up the operating systems, network management and learning how to use the Weather Research and forecasting Model (WRF). Our cluster had 8 nodes each packed with 20 intel cores, 1 Nvidia K40 GPU and an Intel Xeon Phy accelerator. The interconnect was infinibad and 100 Gigabit Ethernet. Aside from that we did intense exploration of using ARM processors for big iron applications, which we didn't get to showcase but are a really promising technology for packing more computational power without using much electrical power.

Title: International Business Director
Headline: A Greener and Sustainable future is possible and doable
Summary:
Life gifted me a second chance back in 2007, and I transformed that opportunity into a mission to revolutionise multiple industries through technology and sustainable innovation. My journey from recovery to renaissance shaped me into a resilient leader who sees opportunities where others perceive obstacles.

As a serial entrepreneur and C-level executive, I've built and scaled companies across the US, Latin America, and Europe, specialising in IT, Green Tech, and startups. My strength lies in bridging cultural and business gaps, leveraging a vast international network, multilingual capabilities and a diverse cultural background to forge powerful partnerships and drive transformative initiatives.

I'm an early technology adopter who consistently stays ahead of market trends, translating emerging innovations into tangible business opportunities. My leadership philosophy centers on example-setting and fostering environments where innovation thrives and sustainable solutions flourish.

Today, my focus is on harnessing technology's potential to create a more sustainable world. I'm passionate about collaborating with forward-thinking organisations and individuals who share my vision of leveraging tech innovation to build a greener, brighter future for generations to come.

My journey taught me that every challenge presents an opportunity for transformation. This perspective, combined with my business development expertise and cross-cultural fluency, enables me to identify and execute opportunities that others might overlook.

Headline: Wealth Adviser, Chief Executive Officer at TQM Wealth Partners
Summary:
Wealth is more than numbers on a balance sheetâ€”itâ€™s about the life it allows you to live and the impact you create.

At TQM Wealth Partners, we understand that money evokes deep emotions. Iâ€™ve had clients with millions in their portfolios share their fear of running out of money. This reminds me that wealth is deeply personal.   

Thatâ€™s why every client at TQM Wealth Partners receives a comprehensive financial plan tailored to their unique goals and challenges.  

This plan isnâ€™t just about investments or taxes. Itâ€™s about giving you the confidence to navigate lifeâ€™s uncertaintiesâ€”whether that means: 
- ensuring you donâ€™t draw from your portfolio at the wrong time, 
- safeguarding your familyâ€™s future, or 
- aligning your wealth with your values.  

As the founder and CEO of TQM Wealth Partners, Iâ€™ve built our firm as a boutique with large-scale capabilities. 

This means you receive personalized, relationship-driven services grounded in your best interest standard. You benefit from the strength and resources of a multinational financial services institution. To enhance your experience, we bring top-tier investment managers and longevity planning experts to address every facet of your financial well-being.  

My understanding of the unique needs of high-net-worth individuals and families stems from more than 25 years of experience across roles in private banking, corporate lending, and wealth management. 

Whether raising capital for financial intermediary funds in Latin America, leading corporate lending teams at Banco Mercantil, or serving as a Private Wealth Advisor at Merrill Lynch, Iâ€™ve always focused on what truly matters to people who have built significant wealth: peace of mind, purpose, and impact.  

Now, as a Retirement Management Advisor (RMA), I help you turn your prosperity into meaningful, fulfilling lives. 

Iâ€™ve learned that a well-crafted financial plan does more than grow wealthâ€”it empowers you to focus on whatâ€™s most important, live your legacy every day, and make decisions aligned with your deepest values.  

At the heart of TQM Wealth Partners is a simple yet profound mission: to help you cultivate clarity, confidence, and joy in your financial journey. Your wealth should be a source of freedom, not fear. It should inspire possibilities, not stress. And it should reflect the life you envision for yourself, your loved ones, and the generations to come.  

Letâ€™s explore how we can bring greater meaning and security to your wealth, together. Visit https://www.tqmwealthpartners.com/ or contact me directly to begin the conversation.
Summary - Projects: The Legacy DialoguesTM are thought-provoking, stimulating, and transformative conversations about different ways people identify and determine what is most valuable to them, what their definition of â€œlegacyâ€ is, if they live and plan for the depth of the mark that indicates that they are or once were present or otherwise important in the world, and how they want to be remembered. Those involved in the dialogues have the power to turn the conversations into actions and to lead others in doing the same. Title - Courses: Analyzing Data with Python - IBM course EdX
Summary - Projects: Our proposal introduces YACHA, which tackles the â€œThree Eâ€™sâ€ of youth inclusionâ€”Education, Employment, and Experience, to create a network of engaged Bolivian leaders that, in true Andean-culture fashion, celebrates and fosters community-driven knowledge sharing. At its core, YACHA is an innovative and accessible multi-platform solution for Bolivians aged 16-25 who seek educational opportunities, vocational orientation, and mentorship. Facilitating vocational and professional connections, YACHA advances youth inclusion by simultaneously bridging inter- and intra-generational gaps and engaging young Bolivian leaders, especially minorities and disadvantaged youth. Inspired by the community-driven nature of YACHA, a Quechua term that refers to â€œthe practice of acquiring knowledge from experiences,â€ our solution takes an interdisciplinary approach to the challenges of youthâ€™s social inclusion. In this way, we do not seek to extend beyond the problem at hand but, rather, we seek to â€œreturn to the rootsâ€ of Andean learning from an innovative and inclusive perspective. This report sheds light on the issue of education and employment in Bolivia, grounding our proposal on data-driven research that cuts across the fields of economics, sociology, development studies, and politics, among others. YACHA is a first step in the direction for the inclusion of Boliviaâ€™s young leaders.

With over 7+ years of work experience in the oil and gas industry, I am Drilling Fluids Engineer at Halliburton, where I develop and deliver customized and innovative solutions for drilling and completion fluids. My core competencies include problem solving, analytical skills, project planning, and resource management. I am driven by the mission of maximizing wellbore value and customer satisfaction, while ensuring safety, quality, and environmental compliance. I have experience with oil-based, water-based, and clear fluid systems, and I use tools such as DFG and Wellsight 20/20 to monitor and optimize the fluid performance. I have also been recognized as the MVP 2023 for Maximizing value-aded, performance and contribution in delivering Baroid's value proposition.

Title: Graduate Teaching Assistant
Headline: Electrical, Power and Energy Engineer
Summary:
Current Activity:
I am currently a final-year Ph.D. candidate in Electrical Engineering at Texas A&M University, specializing in AC Microgrid design and the development of advanced protection schemes. My research is dedicated to advancing the field of renewable energy integration and ensuring the resilience of microgrid systems in the face of dynamic operational challenges.

Research Focus:
My primary focus lies in the following areas:

AC Microgrid Design: Investigating innovative methodologies for the efficient design and optimization of AC Microgrid architectures, with an emphasis on enhancing system performance and reliability.
Protection Scheme Development: Pioneering the development of robust protection schemes tailored for AC Microgrids. This includes exploring adaptive and intelligent solutions to safeguard against faults and disturbances, ensuring the stable and secure operation of microgrid networks.
Renewable Energy Integration: Contributing to the advancement of renewable energy integration strategies within microgrid systems. This involves studying the optimal integration of diverse renewable sources to maximize energy efficiency and sustainability.

Current Projects:
Project 1: "Optimizing AC Microgrid Performance through Smart Control Strategies"
Project 2: "Enhancing Resilience in Microgrid Networks: Adaptive Protection Mechanisms"
Project 3: "Integrating Distributed Energy Resources for Sustainable Microgrid Operation"

Collaborations and Publications:
I am actively collaborating with peers and industry experts in the field, fostering interdisciplinary discussions and knowledge exchange. Additionally, I have contributed to several peer-reviewed publications, addressing key challenges and advancements in AC Microgrid research.

Future Endeavors:
As I approach the completion of my Ph.D., I am excited to continue my research journey in academia or industry, contributing to the ongoing evolution of sustainable energy systems.

Feel free to connect for discussions, collaborations, or to explore shared research interests.

This project sought to be as dynamic and entertaining as possible, given our audience. Our activities were developed strategically, so that the children take ownership of knowledge, behaviors and attitudes toward recycling. It was divided into three sections: project profile (diagnosis and proposal), implementation and evaluation.

Headline: Head of Financial Risk @ Banco Sol | Risk Analytics | Excel VBA| RStudio | Liquidity Assessment | Credit Risk | Environmental Sustainability | Resilience Building | Compliance Expert | Team Development | Ikigai Believer
Summary:
Financial Engineer and Economist | Passionate about Financial Risk Management and Economic Analysis

My journey into the dynamic world of financial risks and economic analysis began in 2019 at Banco Mercantil Santa Cruz, where I discovered my true calling: transforming risks into opportunities. Through process improvement and automation, I have developed a proactive approach to managing challenges, always striving to create sustainable and impactful solutions.

As Head of Financial Risk at Banco Sol, I have deepened my understanding of the financial landscape and strengthened my commitment to turning risks into opportunities that transform lives, all while advocating for sustainability and environmental responsibility.

Key Achievements:

Migration of Banco Fassil's Portfolio:
Successfully analyzed and managed the integration of the former Banco Fassil's portfolio into Banco Solidario, valued at approximately USD 133MM, utilizing advanced tools such as Excel VBA and RStudio.

Gender Risk Analysis for Avanza Mujer Portfolio:
Conducted an in-depth analysis of client flow within the Avanza Mujer portfolio, enhancing the understanding of client retention and growth across various archetypes. This initiative addressed gender-related risks and improved decision-making for a portfolio of over 166,000 clients.

Pandemic-Related Portfolio Deferrals:
Led the analysis of deferred portfolios during the pandemic across its various phases, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards, calculating provisions, and successfully defending the methodology before regulatory authorities.

Future Goals & Aspirations:

Innovation in Risk Management:
Redefine risk frameworks to foster resilience and adaptability in the financial sector.

Integration of Sustainability:
Advocate for Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) principles within financial risk models to contribute to a more sustainable future.

I firmly believe that a resilient and sustainable financial future is built through collaboration, innovation, and a shared vision for progress. Letâ€™s connect to explore opportunities to shape a more secure and sustainable world together.

Title: Engineering Manager
Headline: Senior Electromechanical Engineer with over 20 years of experience in Process Control, PLC, DCS, Industrial Communication, Instrumentation, and Commissioning.
Summary:
I have achieved numerous technical certifications that enable me to offer a wide spectrum of solutions to complex problems. My expertise spans Profibus Certified Engineer, Profinet Certified Engineer, Siemens PLCs and DCS, Rockwell PLCs, and DeltaV DCS systems. 

With a decade of leadership in a company specializing in control and automation, I have tackled complex problems across various industries, demanding proficiency in the latest automation technologies and continual professional development. My expertise is deeply rooted in programming advanced control systems involving synchronization of medium-voltage motors, process optimization, and industrial communication systems. I have extensive experience with major DCS systems, which bolsters my capability in managing industrial process automation and control.

Additionally, I bring a wealth of experience in control engineering and instrumentation for some of the most significant mining projects currently in operation. This specialized knowledge has been instrumental in enhancing project outcomes and operational efficiencies on a global scale.

My career has granted me the privilege of working on international projects in locations such as Bolivia, Peru, Chile, Mongolia, the United States, and Singapore. This global exposure has enriched my ability to navigate diverse project philosophies and collaborate with multicultural teams, enhancing my adaptability and broadening my professional perspective.

A notable project was my role in the commissioning and operational testing of the main conveyor belt at the Toromocho project, a highly complex system featuring a belt over 5 km long, driven by four medium-voltage motors. These motors required precise electronic synchronization to maintain appropriate tension across the entire length of the belt, showcasing my ability to integrate advanced control systems and ensure stringent operational standards were met.
Summary - Experience: For the past 10 years, I have led the Electrical and Instrumentation Engineering team at Feprom Solutions, facing significant technical challenges across various industrial sectors with a team of over 40 professionals. I was responsible for implementing the first Siemens-licensed factory in Bolivia for low and medium voltage switchboards Sivacon S8 and SIMOPRIME, including ISO 9001 quality certification and all production and design processes. Through this agreement, we have developed major projects that enabled us to export energy distribution systems to Argentina, Chile, Peru, Colombia, and the United States
Summary - Projects: Control and Instrumentation Lead for the Toromocho Expansion Project with Jacobs Engineering. Responsible;e for the design of all the controls and instrumentation for the new plant.

Adicionalmente se desarrolla los estudios, para determinar el tiempo que los operadores necesitan para confecciÃ³n de las capelladas (zapato previo al armado), estos estudios pueden ser costura, empastado, prensado de refuerzo todo lo que involucra en la elaboraciÃ³n del zapato. 
ValidaciÃ³n y verificaciÃ³n de los trazos de materiales y estudios. Una vez que un nuevo modelo ingresa a producciÃ³n, se debe validar que el trazo realizado sea el preciso y de mejor optimizaciÃ³n de material, para que el desperdicio sea el menor posible. VerificaciÃ³n que el estudio asignado o desarrollado en el proceso de confecciÃ³n del calzado sea el mÃ¡s eficiente.

Summary - Volunteering: Centro de Adopciones San Martin de Porres is an animal shelter in Bolivia that takes care of street dogs and cats. Bolivia has a big problem with street animals and sadly the government cares very little. The shelters function based on donations with no fixed facilities, when there is not enough money to pay the rent or the expenses then we are thrown out. Finding a new house big enough to relocate almost 200 animals has always been a struggle. The relocation process is quite traumatic for them since some are very afraid of cars and of new people due to the fact that the majority of them were badly abused. The animals have no individual cages or cages at all, they are all together in whatever garden or yard from the house in which the shelter might be located. This means that when a volunteer comes, all dogs some all at once like a wave and the volunteer might be in danger of being bitten since in between there might be an aggressive or nervous dog. Nevertheless, lending a voice to the ones who can not speak,  taking care of them, showing them love and promoting their adoption has been a rewarding and gratifying experience which as soon as it is possible, I will continue with it.
Role - Volunteering: Taking care of the animals in the shelter

I am an experienced finance professional with an MBA in Finance, Strategy, Execution, and Valuation from DePaul University, Chicago, and over 14 years of expertise in credit risk, structured finance, valuation, M&A, and portfolio management. I have held leadership roles at Fitch Ratings, KPMG, and in the banking sector, where I worked on financial analysis, asset allocation, credit policies, and risk assessments for high-value transactions across sectors like infrastructure, retail, agriculture, healthcare, telecommunications, and agroindustries.
At Fitch Ratings, as Associate Director, I led credit analysis for complex financial instruments such as debentures, CRIs, CRAs, and FIDC quotas, presenting insights to credit committees and ensuring robust credit assessments for large-scale transactions.
Prior to that, at KPMG, I managed valuation and M&A advisory projects, overseeing Fair Value valuations and Purchase Price Allocation (PPA) for multibillion-dollar transactions. I have a proven track record of collaborating with cross-functional teams.
Fluent in English, Portuguese, and Spanish, I have extensive experience in Latin American markets and a strong ability to lead projects across diverse industries.

Headline: I strive for a place where I can exploit my experience in finance and passion for economic development.

I started my career working as a risk analyst in a financial leasing firm where my duties included estimating probability of default and expected loss, as well as assessing the industry specific macroeconomic profile of all the clients.

Company Name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
Title: Teaching Assistant, Department of Anthropology
Headline: Qualitative Research, Human Rights Advocacy, Training and Education.                                                                             Ph.D. candidate in Sociocultural Anthropology
Summary:
I am a Ph.D. candidate in Sociocultural Anthropology at UNC-Chapel Hill (USA). I have obtained a M.A. in Sociocultural Anthropology at UNC, and a Graduate Certificate in International Peace and Conflict Resolution. I have been a Maynard Adams Fellow for the Public Humanities (2020-2021), and I am a Rotary Peace Alumna (2016-2018).
My recent MA project (UNC-CH) has explored the collaborations and tensions between the Human Rights advocates and the Indigenous authorities and movements in the Cauca region, Colombia, in the immediate post-Accord period (2017). My Ph.D. project interrogates how peasant settler communities are being affected by the current emergence of the Rights of Nature, and their complex and contradictory enforcement in the Amazon region of Colombia. My current research involves communities in the north-western region of the Colombian Amazon. 

See: https://anthropology.unc.edu/person/francesca-sorbara/

BACKGROUND & EXPERTISE
I hold a degree in Modern Humanities from the University of Venice (Hons., 2001), and a Master in International Development from the University of Pavia, Italy (2007). I have completed an International Diploma in Humanitarian Assistance at Fordham University, NYC, USA (2009). 
I have worked in the Human Rights field, in local and international NGOs, for over 10 years (2006-2016). During this period, I engaged in institutional and community-based projects, HRBA advocacy initiatives, training and capacity building processes of local and national child protection systems, in Brazil (2004-2005), Ethiopia (2006-2007), Bolivia (2008-2011), and Paraguay (2011-2016). 
Previous to my career in INGOs, I worked as a cultural organizer and a theatre educator in schools and suburbs in Milan, Italy (2001-2004) and in community-based projects in Brazil (2004-2005), mainly in conflictive and marginal communities. 
My training and experience in the psycho-social field include community theatre (Milan, Italy: 2001-2004); popular education and Theatre of the Oppressed (Brazil: 2004-2005; Ethiopia: 2006-2007; Bolivia: 2008-2010); Morenian psychodrama (Paraguay and Argentina: 2011-2015); Biocentric education (Argentina and Brazil: 2014-2015).

I am fluent in four languages: Italian, Spanish, English, Portuguese. I have a good understanding of French and Catalan, and basic communication skills in Amharic.

Summary - Projects: I am Bolivian, and I love my culture. As economist I had the opportunity to participate in projects focused on increasing the living standards and the wellness of the indigenous social groups. However, I feel passion for the cultural expressions of Aymara and Quechua population. For this reason, I have chosen â€œCultural Economicsâ€ as the research line of my PhD. My research project studies the creative industries created by the â€œcholajeâ€ identity. This identity is shared by many urban indigenous in my city, who express their culture through the patronal feasts. On these events, they develop a peculiar cultural economy based on Aymara traditions. Since 2018, I work with different folkloric groups in order to construct a database to study their economy with an empirical approach.
